Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Cementless 3D-Printed vs. Cemented Tibial Components in TKA

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 72 patients were randomised

Intervention.evidence: cementless 3D-printed Triathlon Tritanium (Stryker) cruciate-retaining (CR) TKA or a cemented Triathlon CR (Stryker) TKA

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome, maximum total point motion (MTPM), was measured using radiostereometric analysis (RSA) at baseline, 3 months, and 1, 2, and 5 years postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Patients and outcome assessors were blinded.

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 5 years, the mean MTPM was 0.66 mm (95% CI, 0.56 to 0.78 mm) for the cementless group and 0.53 mm (95% CI, 0.43 to 0.64 mm) for the cemented group (p = 0.09).
